name: DeploySSIS
description: Deploy SQL Server Integration Services Project .ispac file using legacy Package Deployment Model
author: ToxicGlobe

inputs.name: customProjectName
inputs.label: Custom Project Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select Custom Project Name in case of you want to change default Project name defined in .ispac package.

inputs.name: ProjectInlineParameters
inputs.label: Inline Project Parameters
inputs.helpMarkdown: JSON format of Parametrs. See Example on Wiki page.

inputs.name: ProjectJsonParameters
inputs.label: Project Parameters file Path
inputs.helpMarkdown: Path to JSON file. See Example on Wiki page.

inputs.name: createCatalog
inputs.label: Create new Catalog if doesn't exist
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check this option if you want create new Catalog in case it down't exist ont he server.

inputs.name: catalogPassword
inputs.label: New Catalog Password
inputs.helpMarkdown: SSIS Catalog Password. It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'. You may mark variable type as secret to secure it.

inputs.name: FolderName
inputs.label: Name of the SSIS catalog folder
inputs.helpMarkdown: The name of the SSIS catalogfolder into which the project should be deployed. The folder will be created if it doesn't exist.

inputs.name: FolderDescription
inputs.label: Description of the SSIS catalog folder
inputs.helpMarkdown: The description of SSIS catalog folder. This is used only when the folder is created.

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Name of the SQL Server hosting the SSIS catalog database

inputs.name: customConnectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkdown: Custom connection string for the target SSIS Instance. Direct deployment using SQL Authentification is not alowed by SQL Server Architecture.
